name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
benefits: ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments via DBT

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
benefits: Crop insurance: coverage for yield loss, prevented sowing, post-harvest losses

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthan Mahabhiyan (PM-KUSUM)
benefits: Subsidy for installing solar pumps; support for solar power use in irrigation

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PM-KMY)
benefits: Assured pension of ₹3,000 per month after the age of 60. Spouse eligible for 50% family pension after subscriber’s death.

contribution.shared: Equal monthly contribution by farmer and Government

implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
benefits: Financial assistance and subsidies for irrigation infrastructure, micro-irrigation (drip & sprinkler systems), watershed development, and improving on-farm water use efficiency.

implementation.mode: Central Sector & Centrally Sponsored Scheme components
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Jal Shakti, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
benefits: Free soil testing and issuance of Soil Health Cards every 3 years to farmers, providing recommendations on nutrient management and fertilizer use to improve soil health and crop productivity.

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
benefits: Provides short-term credit support for cultivation, post-harvest expenses, working capital for allied activities, and consumption needs. Interest subvention available for timely repayment.

credit_limit.minimum: Based on scale of finance and cropping pattern
credit_limit.maximum: Up to ₹3 lakh for crop loans; higher limits for allied activities

implementation.mode: Issued by banks (Public, Private, RRBs, Cooperative Banks)
implementation.insurance: Covers crops under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
benefits: Financial assistance to promote cluster-based organic farming, certification support, organic input support, and market linkage for organic produce.
objectives: Reduce dependence on chemical fertilizers and pesticides

implementation.financial_assistance: ₹50,000 per hectare over 3 years (including organic inputs, certification, and training)
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
benefits: Financial assistance, training, and input support to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, and commercial crops through productivity enhancement and technology promotion.
objectives: Increase production and productivity of major food crops
Bridge yield gaps in identified districts
Improve farm-level economy and food security

implementation.mode: Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented through State Governments
implementation.nodal_agency: Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: Rythu Bandhu Scheme
benefits: Investment support of ₹5,000 per acre per crop for two crops in a year, provided directly to farmers’ bank accounts to cover input costs like seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.
objectives: Provide financial support to cover crop input costs
Increase farmers’ income and reduce dependency on loans
Encourage timely investment in agriculture for higher productivity

implementation.mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to farmer’s bank account
implementation.frequency: Twice a year (for kharif and rabi seasons)
implementation.nodal_agency: Department of Agriculture, Telangana State Government

name: Formation and Promotion of 10,000 Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs)
benefits: Financial support of ₹18.00 lakh per FPO for 3 years to promote collective farming, better market access, and higher income

name: Electronic National Agriculture Market (e-NAM)
benefits: Online trading platform connecting APMC mandis across India for better price discovery and transparent transactions

name: Minimum Support Price (MSP) for Agricultural Crops
benefits: Guaranteed minimum price for 23 crops to ensure farmers get remunerative prices

name: National Beekeeping and Honey Mission (NBHM)
benefits: Subsidy for beehives, equipment, training, and honey processing units to promote beekeeping

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY-RAFTAAR)
benefits: Flexible funding for agriculture and allied sector projects, innovation, and entrepreneurship development

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)
benefits: Financial support for fisheries infrastructure, aquaculture, and fish processing activities

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
benefits: ₹1 lakh crore fund for post-harvest infrastructure, cold storage, warehouses, and processing units

name: National Mission on Edible Oils - Oil Palm (NMEO-OP)
benefits: Financial assistance for oil palm cultivation to reduce import dependency on edible oils

name: National Livestock Mission (NLM)
benefits: Support for livestock development, breed improvement, feed and fodder development, and skill development
